pageContext.claim: “They [Black Lives Matter demonstrators] were talking about policemen -- policemen and women. Pigs in a blanket, fry them like bacon. So all of a sudden this has taken on this air of great respectability. Well, how does it start there? It's a Marxist group -- it's a Marxist group that is not looking for good things for our country, and now I see these leagues all kneeling down.”
pageContext.analysis: CNN reported those words were chanted at a 2015 protest march held by a group in St. Paul, Minnesota, that was independent of, and not affiliated with, Black Lives Matter -- which is not a singular entity but an informal movement of people calling for racial justice and an end to police brutality and police killings of unarmed African Americans.
